meanings.definition: A container or compartment for storing vegetables at a low temperature
meanings.sent1: I put the fresh lettuce in the crisper to keep it cool.
meanings.sent2: The carrots in the crisper stayed fresh for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The crisper was like a chilly hideout for the veggies.
meanings.sent4: The crisper was a frosty sanctuary for the leafy greens.
meanings.sent5: The crisper kept the vegetables as cold as a winter morning.

meanings.definition: A device used to make food crispy
meanings.sent1: The air fryer is a popular crisper in many kitchens.
meanings.sent2: The oven's crisper function makes the fries crunchy.
meanings.sent3: The crisper worked its magic on the soggy chicken strips.
meanings.sent4: The crisper transformed the soft bread into a crispy delight.
meanings.sent5: The crisper turned the dough into a golden, crunchy treat.

meanings.definition: Having a sharp or distinct appearance
meanings.sent1: Her crisper haircut made her look more stylish.
meanings.sent2: The crisper lines of the design gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: His crisper outfit made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The crisper edges of the painting added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The crisper details in the photo made it more captivating.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something crisper
meanings.sent1: The baker was known as the crisper of cookies in town.
meanings.sent2: The crisper of the potato chips ensured they were crunchy.
meanings.sent3: The crisper of the toast was a master at making it golden brown.
meanings.sent4: The crisper of the fried chicken made it irresistible.
meanings.sent5: The crisper of the pie crust made it perfectly flaky.
